intro: Aletris simpliciflora, commonly known as the simple-flowered aletris, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Aletris simpliciflora typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense mats in suitable habitats.
